result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Correia Silva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon Correia Silva is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon Correia Silva was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

8:21 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Brandon Correia Silva in court.  Attorney Timothy Dale Anderson in court for Brandon Correia Silva.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM342, 22TR1739, 22TR1740, 22TR2946.  Atty Anderson recites joint recommendation.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Carry Concealed Weapon and G to Ct 1- OWI 1st in 22TR1739.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CM342 & Ct 1 in 22TR1739.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CM342 and out right dismisses 22TR1740 & 22TR2946.  Sentencing arguments.
